intro: Pourthiaea laevis, commonly known as the smooth pourthiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
